items.title: Bharat Dynamics: Strong execution drives growth amid margin pressures
items.description: The company’s robust order book, growing export potential, and aggressive capacity expansion plans underpin its long-term growth trajectory

items.title: IT, FMCG, auto, financials see most outflows from FIIs in first half of March
items.description: FII assets under custody showed marginal improvement for the first time since November 2024, rising to Rs 62.86 lakh crore in the first half of March from Rs 62.39 lakh crore in February.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities worth Rs 1096 crore on March 19, while  Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) purchased equities of Rs 2140 crore, on the same day.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty opens above 23,000, Sensex up 350 pts; Vedanta, Hyundai Motor, NCC, IREDA in focus
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: tocks like Raymond, Adani Enterprises, Mishra Dhatu Nigam, Can Fin Homes, HIL, SBFC Finance, and Mahindra Lifespace Developers will be in focus on March 20.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade APL Apollo Tubes, Indian Hotels, Camlin Fine Sciences, Paytm, Bharat Dynamics, IRFC, and others on March 20?
items.description: The bullish bias is expected to sustain in the upcoming sessions. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Wipro, NHPC, Dhani Services, Dishman Carbogen Amcis, Dhanlaxmi Bank in focus on 20 March
items.description: Stocks To Watch, Mar 20: Stocks like Raymond, Adani Enterprises, Mishra Dhatu Nigam, Can Fin Homes, HIL, SBFC Finance, and Mahindra Lifespace Developers will be in focus on March 20.

items.title: Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers shares surge 7% on MoU with Nagaland government; up 35% in a week
items.description: Beyond infrastructure projects, Garden Reach is making strides in naval shipbuilding. The company recently completed Contractor Sea Trials for two warships—Himgiri and Androth—both set to join the Indian Navy.

items.title: Paytm shares crash 6% as Jefferies maintains 'hold', sees marginal upside
items.description: If Paytm’s incentives decline proportionately, its adjusted EBITDA for FY25 could be 50 percent below estimates, while FY26-27 projections may be 20-30 percent lower, Jefferies said.

items.title: Ola Electric needs a new hit product
items.description: Success in motorcycles can put the company firmly on the profitability path

items.title: IREDA launches first-ever perpetual bonds to raise Rs 1,247 crore
items.description: The PSU called perpetual bond issue a 'strategic move' to enhance Tier-I capital to back the expansion of green energy infrastructure, and comes days after the board hiked the borrowing limit for FY25 to Rs 29,200 crore.

items.title: Bulls roar on D-Street: Sensex jumps 500 pts, Nifty reclaims 23,000 post-Fed outcome; small, midcaps in red
items.description: All 13 sectoral indices traded in the green, with Nifty IT leading the charge just a day after tumbling over 2 percent. Heavyweights TCS, Infosys, and Tech Mahindra drove the rebound.

items.title: Infosys, TCS, other IT shares rise as Fed chair Powell assures on growth, maintains 2025 rate cut view
items.description: US Federal Reserve maintained its earlier projection of two rate cuts in 2025, despite inflationary pressures following US President Donald Trump's harsh tariffs.

items.title: SGB fiasco: Why rising gold prices are causing headaches for the government
items.description: The Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) scheme was introduced to steer Indian investors away from physical gold purchases and reduce the country's gold import bill. However, the government’s failure to hedge against rising gold prices has resulted in mounting liabilities, turning the SGB scheme into an expensive financial misstep.

items.title: IGL, MGL shares jump 3% after Axis Capital sees 4 positive triggers for city gas companies
items.description: Axis Capital said that it prefers companies with higher exposure to CNG as they are set to see the fastest growth in the value chain.

items.title: IndiGo shares jump 4%, scales to another record high on healthy outlook
items.description: IndiGo aims to increase its international capacity share to 40 per cent by FY30, expanding beyond its traditionally strong domestic network

items.title: Repco Home finance| can the stock re-rate after a sharp fall?| Stock of the Day
items.description: Repco Home Finance is an established housing finance company in South India, with over 23 years of operations, especially in Tier 2 and 3 cities. Focus on niche, small-ticket, non-salaried home loans, generates higher spreads, but has moderate credit quality of assets. Company’s outlook for loan book growth is encouraging for the coming fiscal. Given the rural focus, the recently announce higher allocation under the PMAY scheme will be beneficial for the company.

items.title: Shipping Corporation of India shares rally 14%, extend gains for 3rd day amid heavy volumes
items.description: SCI's subsidiary Shipping Corporation of India Land and Assets Limited also recorded a strong rise in its share price

items.title: Taking Stock: Market rally continues on fourth day; Nifty crosses 23,200
items.description: All the sectoral indices ended in the green with metal, media, IT, FMCG, auto, consumer durables, realty and telecom up 1 percent each.

items.title: Senco Gold shares hit 5% upper circuit for third consecutive day as promoter raises stake
items.description: In an exchange filing released on March 19, Senco Gold announced that its promoter Jai Hanuman Shri Siddhivinayak Trust has acquired 0.05 percent stake through the open market on March 18.

items.title: Live: Nifty reclaims 23,200 after a month, crosses 50-DMA | Closing Bell
items.description: Market defies expiry fears, rises 4th day. Fed's 2025 rate cut outlook boost bulls.Nifty reclaims 23,200, tops 50-dma. Bank nifty above 50k; eyes 200-dma at 50,950. All sectors in green; oil & gas sector leads. Midcap, smallcap indices continue to rise. Ril, hdfc bank contribute the most. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Sandip Agarwal -Fund manager, Sowilo Investment Managers.

items.title: Rising costs, maxed-out credit could constrain US consumption: Seth Freeman
items.description: GlassRatner Advisory's Seth Freeman said that while the Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has indicated a 50 bps interest rate cut this year, he has missed out a crucial point, which is the outlook on consumer credit.

items.title: Nifty tests 23,200 as rally enters fourth day on broad-based buying
items.description: Following a brief spell in the red, the midcap 100 and smallcap 100 indices clawed backed in the positive with gains of about 0.7 percent each.

items.title: US Fed aware of rising inflation, need to watch for any rate action by June: Peter McGuire
items.description: XM Australia's Peter McGuire said US President Trump wants to emulate the tariff king, William McKinley, the President in the 1880-90s, and wants to create an external revenue service for Americans. He is also keen to bring companies manufacturing in China to bring jobs back home.

items.title: Hindustan Copper shares jump 6% as copper prices hit record high over Trump tariff fears
items.description: Traders scrambled to send as much metal to US as possible ahead of the tariffs. This, in turn, reduced the supply in the rest of the world, shooting up copper prices.
